meanings.definition: A moving staircase consisting of an endlessly circulating belt of steps driven by a motor.
meanings.sent1: The escalator at the mall made going up so easy.
meanings.sent2: I took the escalator instead of the stairs to save time.
meanings.sent3: The escalator seemed to be in a hurry, moving faster than usual.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like an escalator, constantly moving forward.
meanings.sent5: The escalator hummed softly as people rode up and down.

meanings.definition: A stairway whose steps move continuously on a circulating belt.
meanings.sent1: The airport had a long escalator to reach the departure gates.
meanings.sent2: The escalator in the subway station was out of order.
meanings.sent3: The escalator played a tune as each step moved, like a musical staircase.
meanings.sent4: His career felt like an escalator, always moving but never reaching the top.
meanings.sent5: The escalator creaked slightly as it carried passengers effortlessly.
